snippet: One brother, after 16 years in Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi’s prisons, is a lawmaker. The other became Al Qaeda’s No. 2 and was killed in an American drone strike in Pakistan.
abstract: Abdel Wahab Mohamed Qaid, former Islamist militant who is now moderate member of Libya's new Parliament, says his brother Abu Yahya al-Libi, killed in American drone strike in Pakistan, became a radical after being imprisoned by Americans in Afghanistan; charges that many Americans often treat all Islamists as shades of Al Qaeda, in effect pushing them closer to the terrorist group.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Tripoli.

lead_paragraph: One brother, after 16 years in Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi’s prisons, is a lawmaker. The other became Al Qaeda’s No. 2 and was killed in an American drone strike in Pakistan.

headline.seo: Political Islam and the Fate of Two Libyan Brothers
headline.main: Political Islam and the Fate of Two Libyan Brothers
headline.print_headline: From Fighting a Libyan Dictator to Global Jihad: How Two Paths Diverged
